intro: Corydalis gorodkovii subsp. magadanica, commonly known as the Magadan corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the Russian Far East. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh climates. Its leaves are usually basal, forming a rosette, and the stems are slender with a hairy texture. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
